Comments_List: I learned a lot about the Japanese political system, including elections, the relationship between the bureaucrats and politicians, and how certain policies passed or failed.
Learned a lot about Japanese economics and politics, which is not a common topic at Yale
Knowledge of Japanese politics, in particular the electoral system and practices of Japanese political candidates.

It was a well structured course, and although the 3 5-page essays and the 10 page final paper were somewhat of a tough workload to manage, Scott was very understanding about everything. The course was interesting, and engaging, and mostly because I did not know anything about Japan, I learned a lot.
It is conceived of as an overview and might be better taught as a lecture.

Unfortunately it looks like Scott won't be teaching this class anymore as it was his only one at Yale, but if he ever does come back, students should take any class with him because he really loves the subject, engages students to make sure they got the right point of the articles, and is over all a great guy to be around.
Useful as a primer and entry into Japanese politics.
